髭ペンギン: (ヒゲペンギン) - chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)
髭面: (ひげづら) - bearded face; unshaven face; hairy face
髭鷲: (ヒゲワシ) - bearded vulture (Gypaetus barbatus); lammergeier
髮を切る: (かみをきる) - to cut hair; to give a haircut
髷物: (まげもの) - period play (esp. set in the Edo period); period drama
髷結い: (まげゆい) - {sumo} hairdressing of a wrestler's top-knot
鬘: (ばん) - Peruca, peruca, aplique de cabelo, tupe
鬚を生やす: (ひげをはやす) - to grow a beard
鬚虫: (ヒゲムシ) - beard worm (any worm of phylum Pogonophora)
鬚鯨: (ヒゲクジラ) - baleen whale; whalebone whale
鬢: (びん) - Costeletas, patilhas, cabelo nas têmporas
鬢きり: (びんきり) - hairstyle for men and women from early Edo era to the Genroku era
鬢そぎ: (びんそぎ) - cutting a person's sidelocks; evenly cut sidelocks (symbol of adulthood for noblewomen in the Heian era); ritual of cutting the sidelocks (coming-of-age ceremony for women from about 1568-1867)
鬢付け: (びんつけ) - pomade; pomatum; hair oil
鬢付け油: (びんつけあぶら) - pomade; pomatum; hair oil
鬢付油: (びんつけあぶら) - pomade; pomatum; hair oil
鬢切り: (びんぎり) - hairstyle for men and women from early Edo era to the Genroku era
鬢削ぎ: (びんそぎ) - cutting a person's sidelocks; evenly cut sidelocks (symbol of adulthood for noblewomen in the Heian era); ritual of cutting the sidelocks (coming-of-age ceremony for women from about 1568-1867)
鬢差: (びんさし) - bow-shaped whale-bone or copper hairpins used to increase the volume on the side of a woman's hair (Edo period)
鬢差し: (びんさし) - bow-shaped whale-bone or copper hairpins used to increase the volume on the side of a woman's hair (Edo period)
鬢所: (びんしょ) - hairdresser's room in the residence of the shogun or a noble
鬢曽木: (びんそぎ) - cutting a person's sidelocks; evenly cut sidelocks (symbol of adulthood for noblewomen in the Heian era); ritual of cutting the sidelocks (coming-of-age ceremony for women from about 1568-1867)
鬢枇: (びんそぎ) - cutting a person's sidelocks; evenly cut sidelocks (symbol of adulthood for noblewomen in the Heian era); ritual of cutting the sidelocks (coming-of-age ceremony for women from about 1568-1867)
鬢除ぎ: (びんそぎ) - cutting a person's sidelocks; evenly cut sidelocks (symbol of adulthood for noblewomen in the Heian era); ritual of cutting the sidelocks (coming-of-age ceremony for women from about 1568-1867)
鬢髪: (びんぱつ) - hair at the temples; hair at the sides of the head
鬣: (りょう) - Mane , mane (de um cavalo, leão, etc.)
鬣狼: (タテガミオオカミ) - maned wolf (Chrysocyon brachyurus)
鬨の声: (ときのこえ) - war cry; battle cry
鬩ぎあう: (せめぎあう) - to fight each other
鬩ぎ合い: (せめぎあい) - conflict; fighting each other
鬩ぎ合う: (せめぎあう) - to fight each other
鬩ぐ: (せめぐ) - to be mutually bitter/to argue together/to quarrel; to resent and bemoan
鬱ぎ込む: (ふさぎこむ) - to mope; to brood; to be in low spirits; to have the blues
鬱ぐ: (ふさぐ) - (also written 塞ぐ) to feel depressed; to mope
鬱を散じる: (うつをさんじる) - to chase one's gloom away; to free one's thoughts from melancholy
鬱勃: (うつぼつ) - irresistible force or movement
鬱憤: (uppun) - ressentimento, rancor, raiva contida, frustração, amargura
鬱憤を晴らす: (うっぷんをはらす) - to vent one's anger
鬱憤晴らす: (うっぷんはらす) - to vent one's anger
鬱状態: (うつじょうたい) - depressive state (e.g. of manic depression); depressive condition
鬱積: (うっせき) - accumulation (e.g. of emotions, grievances, etc.); buildup; suppression (e.g. of anger)
鬱血除去薬: (うっけつじょきょやく) - decongestant
鬱陶しい: (uttoushii) - gloomy (ex. humor), depressing; irritating, troublesome , gloomy (e.g. mood), depressing; irritating, troublesome; heavy (weather), cloudy
鬼: (ki/oni) - ghost , oni, ogre, demon; spirit of a deceased person; ogre-like person (i.e. fierce, relentless, merciless, etc.); it (in a game of tag, hide-and-seek, etc.)
鬼が出るか仏が出るか: (おにがでるかほとけがでるか) - God only knows what may happen
鬼が出るか蛇が出るか: (おにがでるかじゃがでるか) - You never know what might happen
鬼が島: (おにがしま) - mythological island of demons
鬼が笑う: (おにがわらう) - to be laughable; to be unrealistic
鬼っ子: (おにっこ) - child born with teeth; child which does not resemble its parents/changeling; wild child/badly-behaved child
鬼に金棒: (おににかなぼう) - making a strong person even stronger (like giving a metal rod to an ogre); as strong as can be
鬼のように: (おにのように) - very/extremely; like the devil/as a demon
鬼の居ぬ間に洗濯: (おにのいぬまにせんたく) - when the cat's away, the mice will play; relaxing while the demon is out
鬼の形相: (おにのきょうそう) - furious facial expression
鬼の目にも涙: (おにのめにもなみだ) - even the hardest of hearts can be moved to tears
鬼の矢幹: (オニノヤガラ) - Gastrodia elata (species of saprophytic orchid)
鬼の霍乱: (おにのかくらん) - person of strong constitution unexpectedly falling ill; sickness of a stout man; the devil getting sunstroke
鬼の首を取ったよう: (おにのくびをとったよう) - triumphant (over a mediocre achievement); boastful; as if one had grabbed a demon by the neck
鬼は外福は内: (おにはそとふくはうち) - (recital chanted on Setsubun during the bean-scattering ceremony)  out with the demon, in with fortune; devils out, good luck in
鬼みそ: (おにみそ) - grilled miso mixed with chili peppers; person who acts tough but is actually timid
鬼も十八番茶も出花: (おにもじゅうはちばんちゃもでばな) - just as even coarse tea tastes good when fresh, even homely girls look beautiful at the peak of their youth
鬼カサゴ: (オニカサゴ) - scorpionfish (Scorpaenopsis cirrhosa); hairy stingfish
鬼ケ島: (おにがしま) - mythological island of demons
鬼ヶ島: (おにがしま) - mythological island of demons
鬼乳: (きにゅう) - witch's milk (milk secreted by some neonates)
鬼利死丹: (キリシタン) - early Japanese Christianity (from the later Muromachi period) (por: cristao); early Japanese Christian
